proxyBenefits.title: Benefits of Plugged.in MCP
proxyBenefits.description: Plugged.in MCP acts as a unified proxy for all your MCP servers, providing several advantages:
benefits: Single Configuration Point - Manage all your MCP servers through one central configuration
Automatic Updates - Get the latest features and security updates automatically
Simplified Authentication - Use a single API key for all your MCP servers
Enhanced Security - Built-in security features and best practices
Cross-Platform Compatibility - Works seamlessly across different operating systems

step1.description: Open Claude Desktop and navigate to Settings > MCP Servers.

step2.title: Locate Configuration

step3.description: Paste the snippet below inside the "mcpServers" object. It already includes your API key.

step4.title: Restart Application
step4.description: Restart Claude Desktop to load the new MCP configuration.

claudeCode.title: Claude Code Setup

step1.title: Step 1: Open Claude Code Settings
step1.description: Open Claude Code and use the command palette (Cmd/Ctrl+Shift+P) to search for "MCP Settings".

step2.title: Step 2: Access MCP Configuration
step2.description: In the settings modal, open the MCP Servers section to manage local configurations.

step3.title: Step 3: Add Plugged.in MCP Server
step3.description: Run the command below in a terminal where Claude Code is installed. It registers the Plugged.in proxy with your API key.

step4.title: Step 4: Apply Configuration
step4.description: Refresh the MCP Servers list in Claude Code to load the new entry.

step5.title: Step 5: Test Connection
step5.description: Run `claude mcp list` or open Claude Code to confirm the Plugged.in server is available.
